comments: a(n) = determinant of the (n+1) X (n+1) matrix with 0's in the main diagonal and 1's elsewhere. - _Franz Vrabec_, Dec 01 2007Sum_{n>0} 1/a(n) = -log(2). - _Jaume Oliver Lafont_, Feb 24 2009Pisano period lengths:  1, 2, 6, 4, 10, 6, 14, 8, 18, 10, 22, 12, 26, 14, 30, 16, 34, 18, 38, 20, ... (is this A066043?). - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 10 2012
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-2,-1).
formula: G.f.: -x/(1+x)^2.E.g.f: -x*exp(-x).a(0)=0, a(1)=-1, a(n) = -2*a(n-1) - a(n-2) for n>=2. - _Jaume Oliver Lafont_, Feb 24 2009
mathematica: lst={}; Do[AppendTo[lst,n*(-1)^n],{n,0,6!}]; lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jan 18 2009 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [n*(-1)^n: n in [0..80]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 08 2011(PARI) a(n)=n*(-1)^n \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 07 2011(Haskell)a038608 n = n * (-1) ^ na038608_list = [0, -1] ++ map negate   (zipWith (+) a038608_list (map (* 2) $ tail a038608_list))-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 24 2012
crossrefs: Cf. A002162, A155988. - _Jaume Oliver Lafont_, Feb 24 2009
